required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Thread Lift by Use of Retaining Ligaments
clinical_study.official_title: Thread Lift by Use of Retaining Ligaments With V-lock Barbed Sutures

brief_summary.textblock: In facial rejuvenating surgery, the current trend calls for fewer and less noticeable scars with desired results. Especially to improve the jowls and nasolabial folds, the thread lift is a simple and inexpensive technique for patients who do not wish to undergo the typical facelift surgery, but the weak points of it are less effective and shorter duration than the conventional facelift.The investigators propose the new method of the thread lifting the subdermal and subcutaneous layer with a fiberoptic needle by use of the retaining ligaments with two fixation points on both temporal fascia and retaining ligaments.

detailed_description.textblock:
In facial rejuvenating surgery, the current trend calls for fewer and less noticeable scars with desired results. Especially to improve the jowls and nasolabial folds, the thread lift is a simple and inexpensive technique for patients who do not wish to undergo the typical facelift surgery, but the weak points of it are less effective and shorter duration than the conventional facelift.The investigators propose the new method of the thread lifting the subdermal and subcutaneous layer with a fiberoptic needle by use of the retaining ligaments.
This technique was performed in 97 patients, of whom 77 patients had primary procedures, and 20 patients underwent secondary procedures. All of 95 patients were highly satisfied with the results. There are no infection, no nerve injury, and no hematoma, but two reoperation cases due to suboptimal results.The thread lift by use of the retaining ligaments with V-lock barbed sutures is an alternative technique in the facelift.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Serious and Non-Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: reoperation due to suboptimal outcome : 2 cases infection :0 case nerve injury : 0 case

arm_group.description: In facial rejuvenating surgery, the current trend calls for fewer and less noticeable scars with desired results. Especially to improve the jowls and nasolabial folds, the thread lift is a simple and inexpensive technique for patients who do not wish to undergo the typical facelift surgery, but the weak points of it are less effective and shorter duration than the conventional facelift.The investigators propose the new method of the thread lifting the subdermal and subcutaneous layer by use of the retaining ligaments with two fixation points on both temporal fascia and retaining ligaments.

intervention.description: In facial rejuvenating surgery, the current trend calls for fewer and less noticeable scars with desired results. Especially to improve the jowls and nasolabial folds, the thread lift is a simple and inexpensive technique for patients who do not wish to undergo the typical facelift surgery, but the weak points of it are less effective and shorter duration than the conventional facelift.The investigators propose the new method of the thread lifting the subdermal and subcutaneous layer by use of the retaining ligaments with two fixation points on both temporal fascia and retaining ligaments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primary case
- secondary case
Exclusion Criteria:
- wide scar tissue on face
- allergy to foreign body(thread)
- no skin excess

facility.name: The Department of Plastic Surgery, Winners Clinic

reference.citation: Sasaki GH, Cohen AT. Meloplication of the malar fat pads by percutaneous cable-suture technique for midface rejuvenation: outcome study (392 cases, 6 years' experience). Plast Reconstr Surg. 2002 Aug;110(2):635-54; discussion 655-7.
